public interface zeta.session.Unit

(source file: Unit.pizza)
java.lang.Object
   |
   +----zeta.session.Unit
The pure class interface. 
public interface Unit
The type of units. Units are the means of data representation in the repository. The actual content (the data) of a unit can be represented in different content types, Unit offers methods to get (query) and define contents in a specified type. For Z specifications, a unit is a section of a Z document, or, for mSZ, a class.

Author:
Wolfgang Grieskamp (wg@cs.tu-berlin.de)
Version: $Id: Unit.pizza,v 1.7 2000/05/12 07:42:56 wg Exp $

define(ContentType, Serializable, boolean, Date, Target[], Adaptor)
Define contents of given type
getFileName()
Return a string suitable as a base file name derived from this units name
getName()
Return the Name of this unit
isUptodate(ContentType)
Check if contents of given type is present and up-to-date
link(ContentType, ContentType)
Link content of given type to other type
outdate(ContentType)
Explicitely outdate the contents of given type.
query(ContentType)
Query contents of type of this unit

getName
public abstract Name getName();
Return the Name of this unit.

getFileName

public abstract String getFileName();
Return a string suitable as a base file name derived from this units name.

query

public abstract Serializable query(ContentType type)
  throws zeta.session.Failures.ComputationFailed, zeta.session.Failures.CannotCompute;
Query contents of type of this unit. If the contents is not present or not up-to-date, tool adaptors will be called to compute it.

Throws:
Failures.ComputationFailed - if, in the chain of adaptors that tried to computed the requested content, the computation of one adaptor failed.
Failures.CannotCompute - if the repository could not compute the the requested content, because there is no tool chain that could compute the content.
See also:
tryCompute

isUptodate

public abstract boolean isUptodate(ContentType type);
Check if contents of given type is present and up-to-date. Return true if this is the case, false if the content is outdated and needs to be (re-)computed.

outdate

public abstract void outdate(ContentType type);
Explicitely outdate the contents of given type.

define

public abstract void define(ContentType type,
                            Serializable content,
                            boolean persistent,
                            Date createdAt,
                            Target[] dependencies,
                            Adaptor adaptor);
Define contents of given type. This method is used by adaptors, to define a computed content.

Parameters:
type - the defined content type.
content - the actual content (must be of class type.type).
persistent - specify whether the content is to be kept persistent.
createdAt - time content was created (i.e. creation started).
dependencies - targets, this content depends of (the content has to be recomputed if one of the dependencies is changed).
adaptor - the adaptor that has created the content.

link

public abstract void link(ContentType otherType,
                          ContentType type);
Link content of given type to other type. Querying the content of the given type for this unit will be redirected to querying the content of the other type. The content classes must be compatible (the given contents class is assignable from the other contents class).
